instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good” and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.SMC_TCK: What is SMC_TCK? SMC_TCK is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_TDI: What is SMC_TDI? SMC_TDI is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 quarter fan spin
threads.message:
WD, passed in the UC

2 Quarter Fan Spin
No green Light
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 8.19V <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> not talking to SMC
PP3V42: 3.415V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_GH</SIGNAL>: 3.328V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>: 4.987V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>: 0V
CPUVCore, Pins 7 & 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> twice too

Able to read SPI Rom, and doesn't look corrupted.
Checked all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces: OK

R17/18: 3.4 Ohms
R27/28: 20.5 Ohms
<SIGNAL>SMC_TDI</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_TCK</SIGNAL> shorted to GND under SMC

reflowed SMC: fan was spinning at full speed then stopped after 2-3 minutes but still <SIGNAL>SMC_TDI</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_TCK</SIGNAL> shorted to GND.
Waited turned off and on then came back to 2 quarter fan spin.
When I put my probe on <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> at <RESISTOR>R1451</RESISTOR> the fan does a quarter spin, this rail is directely connected to the SMC

Before removing SMC for reballing any suggestion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 quarter fan spin
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>SMC_TDI</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_TCK</SIGNAL> shorted to GND under SMC"
If is pure short, reballing doesn't help; change the SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 quarter fan spin
threads.message:
Reballed SMC :
Short to GND for <SIGNAL>SMC_TDI</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_TCK</SIGNAL> GONE both: 3.414V
Goes in S3 State
Fan Spin at ful speed around  few minutes then stops
 NO Green Led
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 8.19V  
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>: 0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_S4_WAKESRC_EN</SIGNAL>: 0V

All symptoms looks like SMC Dead or pb in reballing ( I'm not an expert in reballing: took few hours to reball this one and some ball smaller that the others )

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 quarter fan spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 quarter fan spin
threads.message:
I reballed the SMC again.
Now I'm almost sure my reballing job is ok.
Unfortunately The board reacts the exact same way: DEAD SMC
00165 are compatible with 00164 right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 quarter fan spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2 quarter fan spin
threads.message:
OK thanks
Just to let you know that I reballed it again ( 100% sure )  exact same issue.
Will try to get a 00165 SMC
